page.title: 02Local History -East Wemyss
page.content: East Wemyss is a small coastal village on the estuary of the River Forth. The name 'Wemyss' is derived from the weems or caves which lie between Buckhaven and East Wemyss. The word 'weem' comes from the Gaelic word 'uamha' which means caves. East Wemyss was originally known as Castleton as it was near to Macduff Castle and the people who worked in the castle lived in East Wemyss. East Wemyss and Coaltown of Wemyss were mining villages from the early 19th century until 1968. The opening of the Michael Colliery, in 1898, meant a rapid growth in the size of the village and the services it provided. In 1967 the colliery was closed after a fire which killed 9 men. The closure was a terrible blow to the Wemyss villages which have declined ever since.
